heisig_story: You can think of this kanji as a stylized pictograph of the nose, that little drop that Mother Nature set between your eyes. The Japanese refer to themselves by pointing a finger at their nose - giving us an easy way to remember the kanji for oneself.

humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The inscription " Zi " on the elephant's nose. Lin Yiguang and Shang Chengzuo believe that the lines and wrinkles on the two horizontal elephant trunks are the original text of " nose ", and the original meaning is nose. Later, because people often refer to their own noses when referring to themselves, they use the trunk-shaped " self " to express themselves.

The character form "è‡ª" in Oracle bone inscriptions means two words, which are both the original text of " bi " and the " self " (Lin Yuan) that expresses oneself. Later, in order to distinguish between the two characters, the sound symbol "ç•€" was added under "è‡ª" to create the word " nasal " to represent the nose, see " nasal ". "Said Wen. "Self": "Self, nose. Elephant trunk shape. Everything that belongs to self is from self. ğ¦£¹, ancient text is self." Xu Hao, "Shu Wen Jie Zi An Annotation": "A person refers to his or her nose, so there is My name."

The bottom strokes of the oracle bone inscriptions are not connected, like two nostrils, and the bottom strokes of the inscriptions start to connect.

The oracle bone inscription is used as the original meaning to mean the nose. "Compilation" 11506 is: "Illness from" means that the nose is sick. He also expressed himself, personally, "Compilation" 24951: "King Wang Zizheng (levying)", referring to the King of Shang personally set off. He also expressed Cong, "Compilation" 24228: "Wang step from business", which means that Wang travels in business. "Collection" 28188: "ZiYang Zhi Yu Gao", "ç€¼" and " cream " are both place names.

Jin Wen said that he, Uncle Zhenyan: "From the first (made) recommended ğ ¤³ (ç° )", "ç° " is a food container, meaning that oneself casts the ç°  for food. It also expresses obedience and reason, and makes Ding: "The king returns to Tiantian." Meng Gui: "Yi (given) Zhenwen Kaochen self-employed" means that Mao Gong took out his servants from his own servants to reward Meng's father (Qiu Xigui).

The bamboo slips of the Warring States period express naturally, "Guodian Slips. "Lao Zi Jia" Jane 23: "Daao (Fa) is natural", which means that Dao is pure and natural (Chen Guying). "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 19: "The one who is far away comes here." "Guodian Jane. "Lao Zi Jia" Jane 31: "I have nothing to do but the people get rich." It also expresses from and from, "Guodian Jian. "Natural Life Comes Out" Jane 2-3: "You (sex) come out of your own life, Life comes from the sky." "Shangbo Bamboo Book Six. "Yiyue" Jane 9: "Misfortune does not come from the sky, nor from the earth." It also expresses calmness and freedom, without restraint, "Shangbo Bamboo Book Seven. "Fan Logistics Form A Book" Jian 18: "Winter (end) body is free."
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The inscription " Zi " is like a human nose. Later, when people talk about themselves, they often use their fingers to point to their noses, so they are also used to express themselves.
